main event: A UFO was sighted by an observer over Trenton, New Jersey on November 7, 1955 from 2130-2155Z.
interesting points: The object was sighted to the right of the moon, moving from the north at a slow, steady pace.
The sighting was reported by a McGuire AFB officer, Lt. C.F. Demos.

Another document describes the sighted object as having a general circular shape, being the size of 0.065 inches, white in color, with no discernible features or details, no trail or exhaust, and no sound.
The object's flight path was described as irregular and disturbing slightly, ranging from the northeast to the east.

The observer was located 1/2 mile from the Trenton Battle Monument in a northerly direction and was described as quite sincere, having studied astronomy and being certain it was not an aircraft or meteor.
